intro: Eutropia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. Eutropia brasiliensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
